RIM SequenceÂ¶

class RIM_sequence.RIM(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any)Â¶

Subclass model to create recurrent inference machine

If the problem is 2D, we assume the input is square.

assign_learning_rate_function(learning_rate_function)Â¶

Assign learning rate function based off userâ€™s input

Parameters:

learning_rate_function â€“ Selected learning rate function

call(test_dataset, training=False)Â¶

A single run through the recurrent inference machine for prediction purposes

Parameters:

test_dataset â€“ batch test set (X_test, Y_test, A_test)

Returns:

Solution vector of the form (test_number, timesteps, vector)

Return type:

solutions

exp_decay(epoch)Â¶

Update the learrning rate at the end of epoch drop based on the decay equation

\[\alpha = \frac{\alpha_0}{1+\eta*floor(\epsilon/\text{epoch drop})}\]
Parameters:

epoch â€“ Current epoch of training (epsilon)

Returns:

Updated learning rate

fit(batch_size, epochs, train_dataset, val_dataset)Â¶

A full training and validation algorithm

Call with the following

ysol_valid, training_loss, valid_loss, learning_rates = model.fit(batch_size, epochs, train_dataset, val_dataset)
Parameters:

  • batch_size â€“ number of batches (int)

  • epochs â€“ number of epochs (int)

  • train_dataset â€“ batched training set (X_train, Y_train, A_train, C_train)

  • val_dataset â€“ batched validation set (X_valid, Y_valid, A_valid, C_valid)

Returns:

Solution vectors for validation set (batch, timesteps, values) training_loss_values: Vector of training loss values valid_loss_values: Vector of validation loss values learning_rate_values: Vector of learning rate values

Return type:

ysol

learning_rate_decay(epoch)Â¶

Update the learrning rate at the end of each epoch based on the decay equation

\[\alpha=\frac{\alpha_0}{1+\eta*\epsilon}\]

step_decay(epoch)Â¶

Update the learning rate at the end of a given epoch

\[\alpha = \alpha_0 * \eta**floor(\epsilon/\text{epoch drop})\]

test_step(step, y, model, A, C, batch_size, return_state=True)Â¶

Test network on test data (no training)

Parameters:

  • y â€“ Batched observed spectra for test set

  • model â€“ RIM_model instance

  • A â€“ Batched response matrix for test set

  • C â€“ Batched noise covariance matrix for test set
